properties.areaDesc: Mississippi, MO; New Madrid, MO; Fulton, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 8 at 12:21PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...Missouri...

Mississippi River at New Madrid

.Heavy rainfall is forecast over the Middle Mississippi River basin
Sunday into Monday and the potential exists for more rain during the middle
part of the week. Also, heavy rain is forecast upstream across the lower
Ohio and Tennessee River basins. As a result, river levels are forecast to
rise over the coming week. At New Madrid, flooding is forecast to begin on
Wednesday. Fluctuations to the forecast are possible depending on how much
rain ends up falling.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Mississippi River at New Madrid.
* from late Tuesday night until further notice.
* At 12:00 PM Saturday the stage was 29.0 feet.
* Flood Stage is 34.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Wednesday morning and continue
to rise to near 36.5 feet by Monday, February 17.
* Impact...At 38.0 Feet...Heavy agricultural damage begins.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
